title.rendered: Offshore Wind Consultants rebrand to OWC

content.rendered:
Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of AqualisBraemar ASA, is rebranding to a new name: OWC

The company was founded in 2011 and for almost five years has been wholly owned by the AqualisBraemar group. OWC is the only global technical advisory company serving exclusively the exploding offshore wind sector, and since those beginnings in London has grown into a global consultancy with offices in London, Edinburgh, Hamburg, Taipei, Boston and Australia with plans to open between two and four additional offices in 2020.

OWC has worked on 43 GW or over 65 offshore wind projects since 2011 and has delivered work in all established and many emerging markets such as the US, Taiwan, Japan, Korea and Vietnam.

“The new brand simply aligns OWC closer to AqualisBraemar without losing the well-earnt reputation of being ‘the offshore wind consultants’. OWC expanded successfully both its offerings and geographic reach and this seemed a natural time to consolidate all we have done to date and look ahead and with that streamline our branding for further global expansion.”

John Macaskill, AqualisBraemar Group Marketing Director

OWC was originally founded by current non-executive Chairman Ian D Bonnon and is led by its Managing Director Will Cleverly.

For further information, please contact:

Investors and financial media

Kim Boman, CFO, AqualisBraemar ASA
Telephone: +47 959 63 912

Other media enquiries

Endre Johansen, Corporate Communications AS
Telephone: +47 41 61 06 05
Email: endre.johansen@corpcom.no

About AqualisBraemar ASA

AqualisBraemar ASA (OSE: Aqua) is a public listed company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers adjusting, marine, offshore and renewables consultancy services to the energy, shipping and insurance industries. The group employs specialist engineers, naval architects, master mariners, loss adjusters and technical consultants in 48 offices located across 5 continents in 31 countries. AqualisBraemar ASA operates under three distinct brands globally:

  • AqualisBraemar a leading adjusting, marine and offshore consultancy to the energy, shipping and insurance industries
  • AqualisBraemar Yacht Services a specialised marine consultant to the superyacht market
  • OWC an independent consultancy to the offshore renewables sector

jetpack-related-posts.title: New MD for Offshore Wind Consultants
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd (OWC) promotes Will Cleverly to the role as managing director of the company.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC to support Erebus floating wind farm
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has entered into a contract to provide engineering services for Simply Blue Energy and Total’s Erebus floating wind project located in the Celtic Sea offshore Wales, UK.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC to support Baltic Sea offshore wind projects
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Baltic Power, subsidiary of Polish energy company PKN Orlen, has retained offshore wind consultancy firm OWC as technical advisor to its 1.2 GW offshore wind development in the Baltic Sea.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar awarded major contract for offshore wind engineering services
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC, a wholly owned subsidiary of AqualisBraemar ASA, has entered into a contract to provide engineering services for an offshore wind development project on the UKCS with an undisclosed client.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC wins ground modelling work
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: A confidential developer has contracted OWC, AqualisBraemar’s wholly-owned renewables arm, to develop a ground model for a US offshore wind project and its cable route. A specialist team of OWC’s geoscience engineers will develop the ground model. OWC will manage the project out of its office in Boston, Massachusetts, USA.…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC awarded Mayflower Wind framework agreement
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Mayflower Wind, the 50/50 joint venture between Shell and EDP Renewables, has awarded a framework agreement to offshore wind consultancy firm OWC for provision of engineering support to the US wind farm development.
